  • Uses of EMediplanObject in org.projecthusky.fhir.emed.ch.epr.model.emediplan

    Classes in org.projecthusky.fhir.emed.ch.epr.model.emediplan that implement EMediplanObject
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    class 
    EMediplan
    This is the main eMediplan object, called Medication in ChMed23A specification.
    class 
    EMediplanExtension
    Extensions can be used to include additional information within an eMediplan that is not explicitly modelled by the ChMed specification.
    class 
    EMediplanHealthcareOrganization
     
    class 
    EMediplanHealthcarePerson
     
    class 
    EMediplanMedicament
    Information about a medication as well as its dosage.
    class 
    EMediplanPatient
     
    class 
    EMediplanPatientId
     
    class 
    EMediplanPatientMedicalData
     
    class 
    EMediplanPostalAddress
    A postal address.
    class 
    EMediplanRisk
    This sould be an enum representation of the CDSCODE table of HCI INDEX used by the eMediplan specification paired with RiskCategory.
    class 
    EMediplanRiskList
    Models the RiskCategory object of eMediplan, that contains risks grouped by category.

    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    class 
    CyclicDosage
    Describes the application of a medication at constant intervals.
    class 
    DailyDosage
    Describes when (morning, moon, evening, night) and how much of a medication must be applied daily, in a structured form.
    class 
    FreeTextDosage
    Describes an unstructured dosage consisting of free text.
    class 
    PosologyDetail
     
    class 
    SequenceDosage
     
    class 
    SingleDosage
    Describes a single application of a medicament.

    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    class 
    Application
    Specifies a dose that must be applied at certain times, either at a precise moment or in a day's segment (i.e.
    class 
    ApplicationAtTime
    Specifies a precise moment in time for a medication to be applied.
    class 
    ApplicationInSegment
    Specifies a day segment (morning, noon, evening or night) when a medication must be applied.

  • Uses of EMediplanObject in org.projecthusky.fhir.emed.ch.epr.model.emediplan.posology.detail.timed

    Classes in org.projecthusky.fhir.emed.ch.epr.model.emediplan.posology.detail.timed that implement EMediplanObject
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    class 
    DaySegmentsDosage
    Specifies the day segment (morning, noon, evening, night) when a medication should be applied.
    class 
    DaysOfMonthDosage
    Specifies on which days of the month a medication must be applied.
    class 
    DoseOnlyDosage
    Specifies a dosage without specifying a precise moment for the intake.
    class 
    EmbeddableTimedDosage
    A TimedDosage that can be embedded within a WeekDaysDosage, a DaysOfMonthDosage or a SingleDosage Inheritors: DaySegmentsDosage DoseOnlyDosage PreciseTimesDosage
    class 
    IntervalDosage
    Specifies the application of a medication with a minimal interval between two applications.
    class 
    PreciseTimesDosage
    Specifies precise times when a medication must be applied.
    class 
    TimedDosage
    Specifies the moment and amount of a medication application.
    class 
    WeekDaysDosage
    Specifies on which days of the week a medication must be applied.
